thread.title: AREA COLLEGES: Bridgewater State women's tennis team keeps winning
thread.title_full: AREA COLLEGES: Bridgewater State women's tennis team keeps winning

author: The Enterprise
title: AREA COLLEGES: Bridgewater State women's tennis team keeps winning
text: Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 8:45 PM Updated at 8:48 PM Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 8:45 PM Updated at 8:48 PM The Bridgewater State University womenâ€™s tennis team remained perfect in the Little East Conference on Monday afternoon. The Bears defeated visiting Salem State University, 9-0, and are now 6-0 in the conference. Singles winners were Alison Vautrin, Alisha Silva, Hayley Anderson, Rebecca Zeuschner, Alison Scagnelli and Bojana Roman. The doubles teams of Silva and Anderson, Vautrin and Olivia Lakes plus Scagnelli and Roman also posted victories. BSU (8-3) has three matches left in the regular season and will be at Gordon College on Wednesday. Adelphi 5, Stonehill 4: The Panthers (13-0) clinched the Northeast-10 Conference regular-season title with the victory in Easton. They have won 29 straight conference regular-season matches and are 12-0 this season in the NE-10. After losing all three doubles matches, Stonehill scored wins in singles with Bailey Paradiso, Analise Kump, Victoria Barbetta and Emily Prinos prevailing. Stonehill (10-3, 9-2 NE-10) closes out its regular season fall schedule on Wednesday at Bentley University and will host a conference tournament first-round match on Oct. 21. By The Enterprise
